result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael George Burns was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
No contact with the Lauritzen's BP Service Station. Defendant is prohibited from engaging in the scrapping of any materials whatsoever.
Defendant to comply with any terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael George Burns

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:35 p.m. Defendant Michael George Burns in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi. No statement by DE. Court orders: 75 days WCJ - Huber, GT, No CFTS - I/S - 9 mos Probation - Conditions: NC w/ Lauritzen's BP Service Station in Wild Rose, Any counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by supervising agent, DE is prohibited from being in the business of the scrapping of any materials, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.
NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  SPD requests P/S date - P/S scheduled as per request.
Status conference on March 11, 2015 at 03:40 pm.
Defendant is prohibited from engaging in the scrapping business.

Case called @ 2:15 p.m. Defendant Michael George Burns in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant referred to SPD.  ADA Anderson requesting $1000 Sig Bond. Statement by DE regarding bond. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond.  NGP entered.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 03:40 pm.
